SEARCH
Package com.bhoffpauir.blisp.lib

Interface Procedure

All Superinterfaces:
Function<List<Object>,Object>
public interface Procedure extends Function<List<Object>,Object>
A functional interface representing a procedure or function in blisp. The Procedure interface extends Function to take a list of arguments and return a result, both as Object types.

Procedures in this context are higher-order functions that can be passed around and invoked dynamically with varying arguments.

The parameters of the procedure are represented by a List of Object, and the result is also an Object to allow flexibility in handling different data types.

Example usage:

     Procedure add = args -> (NumberAtom) args.get(0) + (NumberAtom) args.get(1);
     Object result = add.apply(List.of(NumberAtom(1), NumberAtom(2))); // Result is 3
